article.para: eXist-db can perform FO (Formatting Objects) rendering inside XQuery code. The FO can be generated used XSL (i.e. XSL:FO) if desired. For this you need to use the xslfo module.

sect1.title: The xslfo module
sect1.para: eXist-db XSL:FO module allows you to do FO rendering from XQuery code using an appropriate FO Renderer; eXist-db supports Apache FOP and RenderX XEP. Previously there was also support for AntennaHouse, but that was removed as it was unmaintained, we would welcome a new contribution to support AntennaHouse again.
Selection of the renderer is configured in eXist-db's conf.xml file. By default eXist-db ships with and is configured to use Apache FOP, see: Using the Apache FOP Renderer
If you wish to use RenderX XEP instead, see Using the RenderX XEP FO Renderer.

sect2.para: The xsl:render function renders an FO document and returns you the result. It has two signatures:

listitem.para: The FO document to be rendered.
The Internet Media Type of the desired result. This provides a hint to the renderer as to what format it should render
Specify any optional parameters for the rendering of the FO document, these are processor specific.
An optional configuration document for the processor, this is processor specific.

title.code: Streaming the result to a Web Browser

sect2.para: If you wish to Stream the result of xslfo:render directly to the Web Browser (i.e. HTTP Response), you can send the output of xslfo:render directly to the function response:stream-binary. This can be useful for example when you want an XQuery to download a PDF directly to the Web Browser.

sect1.title: Using the RenderX XEP FO Renderer
sect1.para: To configure eXist-db to use RenderX XEP instead of Apache FOP, follow these steps:

listitem.para: From a RenderX distribution, copy the files lib/xep.jar and lib/xt.jar into the folder $EXIST_HOME/lib.
